body_html:
I did some more testing now. When I move the code out of the class then I can call predict without any problem. But when calling the estimator from outside the class like so:

model = Model()
model._estimator.predict(input_fn=input_fn)

Then I get the above mentioned error.
body_text:
I did some more testing now. When I move the code out of the class then I can call predict without any problem. But when calling the estimator from outside the class like so:
model = Model()
model._estimator.predict(input_fn=input_fn)

Then I get the above mentioned error.
body:
I did some more testing now. When I move the code out of the `class` then I can call `predict` without any problem. But when calling the estimator from outside the class like so:
```
model = Model()
model._estimator.predict(input_fn=input_fn)
```
Then I get the above mentioned error.
